info.title: IT Wallet API
info.description: API for the Italian EUDI Wallet implementation profile (version: '0.6.0') https://italia.github.io/eudi-wallet-it-docs/v0.6.0/en/

post.summary: Starts authorization flow for the Wallet Instance
post.description:
1. Wallet Instance have previously:
    • obtained eID Provider federation metadata (Entity Configuration) that discloses the URL endpoints, public keys, algorithms supported, credential types supported, and any other parameter required for interoperability needs;
    • created a PKCE code verifier and its challenge code (SHA256) for the Pushed Authorization Request (PAR Request) to send to this endpoint;
    • created a PAR Request for starting an authorzation flow to obtain an access token that authorize to access to the /credendential endpoint for requestinf an eID credential.
  2. Wallet Instance sends a PAR Request to this endpoint
  3. Authorization Server validates PAR Request received;
  4. Authorization Server extracts the identifier of the Wallet Instance (client_id), the Wallet Instance side application session (state), the WTE and its proof of possession (WTE-PoP), validates and storing them in the local database along with the PAR Request using the state as key;
  5. Authorization Server extracts from the WTE of the Wallet Provider's identifier that issued the Wallet Instance (claim iss) and uses it to verify the presence in the local database of a valid trust chain related to the Wallet Provider (in case of absence it starts a federation flow that provides for building the Wallet Provider's trust chain and storing it in the local database by associating it with the PAR Request);
  6. Authorization Server validates the signature of the WTE using the Wallet Provider's federation public key contained in the Wallet Provider's Entity Configuration retrieved from its trust chain; the identifier of this public key (specified into the claim kid) must match exactly the claim kid specified in the WTE header;
  7. Authorization Server verifies that the Wallet Instance is the rightful owner of the submitted WTE by going to validate the signature of the WTE-PoP and checking if the public key of the Wallet Instance to which the WTE is bound (contained into the WTE claim cnf) is the same public key referenced by the claim kid of the WTE-DPoP header;
  8. Authorization Server extracts the JWT request object from the PAR Request (claim request) and verifies its signature using the public key of the Wallet Instance to which the WTE is bound (contained into the WTE claim cnf);
  9. Authorization Server generates a time-limited disposable request uri that identifies the PAR Request within the Authorization Server (e.g., SHA1 hash of the PAR Request) and creates a PAR Response that encapsulates that URI (claim request_uri) and its validity interval (claim request_uri_expires_in);
  10. Authorization Server stores the identifier of the Wallet Provider, request_uri, request_uri_expires_in and PAR Response in local database by associating them with the previously saved PAR Request
  11. Authorization Server sends PAR Request to the Client.

get.summary: Issuing an authorization code to the Wallet Instance
get.description:
1. Wallet Instance opens its web view and sends an Authorization Request, to this endpoint that presents in query string the Wallet Instance identifier (client_id), the request_uri returned by the PAR Response and the idphint containing the hinted Identity Provider ID;
  2. Authorization Server validates the Authorization Request and stores it in local database along with the idphint presented in query string, associating them with the PAR Request saved previously and identified through the client_id and the request_uri parameters specified in the request;
  3. Authorization Server redirects the Wallet Instance to the login service of the SP with the idphint and a parameter target contains the redirection URI of the Service Provider(SP) to which the SP Assertion Consumer Service redirects the Wallet Instance with the SAML assertion extracted from the verified SAML Response issued by the IdP at the conclusion of the user's authentication flow. The redirect set a session cookie (called state) that contains the unique application session identifier at the Wallet Instance side (previously sent in the PAR Request)

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description: It MUST be set to the same value in the PAR Request (in URL-encoded format)

parameters.name: request_uri
parameters.description: It MUST be set to the same value as obtained by PAR Response (in URL-encoded format)

parameters.name: idphint
parameters.description: The identifier of the hinted Identity Provider ID (in URL-encoded format)

Location.description: The Location response header indicates the URL to redirect the Wallet Instance to. This URL presents in query string a parameter 'idphint' contains the identifier of the hinted Identity Provider (entityID), in URL-encoded format, and a parameter 'target' contains the redirection URI of the SP, in URL-encoded format, to which the SP Assertion Consumer Service redirects the Wallet Instance with the SAML assertion extracted from the verified SAML Response.

Set-Cookie.description: Contains the unique application session identifier at the Wallet Instance side

get.summary: Issuing an authorization code to the Wallet Instance
get.description:
1. Service Provider(SP) sends an HTTP GET request to this enpoint that presents in header HTTP the Minimum eIDAS Dataset attributes of the authenticated user (FamilyName, FirstName, DateOfBirth, PersonIdentifier), the level of authentication (AuthnLevel) performed by the IdP (SpidL2 or SpidL3) and the application session identifier at the Wallet Instance side (state);
  2. Authorization Server validates the request received, extracts request HTTP header informations and stores them into local database (in encrypted form) with association to PAR Request previously received and identified through the state;
  3. Authorization Server generates an authorization code for the Wallet Instance (following RFC_6749 and RFC_7636 specifications) to present to the /token endpoint of the Authorization Server of eID Provider for obtaining an access token that authorize to access to the /credendential endpoint of the Credential Issuer of the eID Provider for requesting an eID credential;
  4. Authorization Server creates an Authorization Response that encapsulates the authorization code producted, the state and the iss of the PAR Request previously received;
  5. Authorization Server redirects the web view of the Wallet Instance to his native side sending a redirect message to the app link/universal link of the Wallet Instance specified in the redirect_uri claim of the PAR Request previously received;
  6. Authorization Server stores the authorization code and the Authorization Response into local database with association to PAR Request previously received.

parameters.name: FamilyName
parameters.description: Family Name of the authenticated user

parameters.name: FirstName
parameters.description: First Name of the authenticated user

parameters.name: DateOfBirth
parameters.description: Date of birth for the authenticated user (YYYY-MM-DD format)

parameters.name: PersonIdentifier
parameters.description: Uniqueness Identifier of the authenticated user (tax id code)

parameters.name: AuthnLevel
parameters.description: The Authentication Level used to authenticate the user

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: It MUST be set to the same value of the 'state' parameter in the PAR Request, in URL-encoded format

302.description:
Found

No content

Redirect URI at the end of the authentication flow:

302_After_Authentication_Flow => EXAMPLE: 'https://start.wallet.example.org?code=SplxlOBeZQQYbYS6WxSbIA&state=fyZiOL9Lf2CeKuNT2JzxiLRDink0uPcd&iss=https%3A%2F%2Fpid-provider.example.org'

302_Authentication_Request_Invalid => EXAMPLE: 'https://start.wallet.example.org?error=server_error&error_description=The%20authorization%20server%20encountered%20an%20unexpected%20condition%20that%20prevented%20it%20from%20fulfilling%20the%20request%20response_type%20value&state=fyZiOL9Lf2CeKuNT2JzxiLRDink0uPcd&iss=https%3A%2F%2Fpid-provider.example.org'

Location.description: The Location response header indicates the URL to redirect the Wallet Instance to. This URL present in query string the authorization code generated by the authorization server (parameter 'code') and the same 'state' and 'iss' parameters were present in the PAR Request (in URL-encoded format). If the request fails due to a missing, invalid, or mismatching redirection URI, or if the Wallet Instance  identifier is missing or invalid, the authorization server MUST NOT automatically redirect the  user-agent to the invalid redirection URI. If the authorization server denies the access request or  if the request fails for reasons other than a missing or invalid redirection URI, the authorization  server informs the Wallet Instance by adding the error parameter (in URL-encoded format) and  the error_description parameter (in URL-encoded format) to the query component of the redirection URI  ([RFC 6749#section-4.1.2.1] https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6749.html#section-4.1.2.1).

post.summary: Issuing an access token to the Wallet Instance
post.description:
1. Wallet Instance have previously:
    • generated a public/private key pair for use with DPoP;
    • created a DPoP proof JWT for the /token endpoint of the Authorizatiuon Server of eID Provider adding the DPoP public key in the JWT header and signed the JWT with the DPoP private key, according to Section 4.2 of the DPoP specification (RFC 9449).
  2. Wallet Instance sends a Token Request, that includes the WTE with its proof of possession (WTE-PoP) and the authorization code, to the /token endpoint of the Authorization Server for issuing an Access Token bounded to the public key of the DPoP proof presented in the DPoP HTTP header of the Token Request;
  3. Authorization Server validates the Token Request and the DPoP proof JWT in the DPoP HTTP header according to Section 4.3 of the DPoP specifications (RFC 9449);
  4. Authorization Server extracts WTE from the Token Request and control is equal to the WTE received previously within the PAR Request;
  5. Authorization Server generates an Access Token bounded to the public key of the DPoP proof JWT presented in the DPoP HTTP header of the Token Request (according to the EUDI IT Wallet specification) that represents the client authorization to access to the /credential endpoint of the Credential Issuer for issuing an eID credential; this Access Token presents a claim sub that contains an identifier assigned to the authenticated user and a claim jkt contains the SHA256 base64-url encoded of the public key defined into the DPoP proof JWT;
  6. Authorization Server creates a string containg a nonce value to be used to create a proof of possession of private key material that the Wallet Instance must present to the /credential endpoint with the access token (this nonce can be used only once and has a limited lifetime);
  7. Authorization Server sends the Token Response containing the DPoP-bounded access token, the authorized verifiable credential types with the DPoP-bound Access Token, the nonce and the nonce expires time
  8. Authorization Server stores the Token Request, the DPoP-bounded access token, the sub of the DPoP-bounded access token, the nonce, the nonce expires time and the Token Response in local databse with association to PAR Request previously received.

parameters.name: DPoP
parameters.description:
The DPoP proof JWT (in signed JWT format) presented in the request to the /token endpoint of the authorization server for issuing an access token bounded to the public key specified within the JWK header of the DPoP proof JWT. The issued DPoP-bounded access token represents the client's authorization to access to the /credential endpoint of the credential issuer for issuing a verifiable credential of type 'PersonIdentificationData'.

Header is a JSON object with this JSON schema

Payload is a JSON object with this JSON schema

post.summary: Issuing an eID Credential to the Wallet Instance

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description:
The DPoP-bound access token (in digitally signed JWT format) presented in the request to the /credential endpoint of the credential issuer for issuing a verifiable credential of type 'PersonIdentificationData'. The access token represents the client's authorization to access to the /credential endpoint of the credential issuer for issuing a verifiable credential of type 'PersonIdentificationData'.

Header is a JSON object with this JSON schema

Payload is a JSON object with this JSON schema

parameters.name: DPoP
parameters.description:
The DPoP proof JWT (in signed JWT format) presented with the access token in the request to the /credential endpoint of the credential issuer as proof possession of the access token sign private key.

Header is a JSON object with this JSON schema

Payload is a JSON object with this JSON schema

200.description:
OK

Header is a JSON object with this JSON schema

Payload is a JSON object with this JSON schema
The verifiable credential (VC) is a digitally signed JWT carrying the information about a subject in clear text and containing SHA256 digests/thumbprints over the selectively disclosable claims with the Disclosures outside the document, using the format defined in draft-ietf-oauth-selective-disclosure-jwt-07 and draft-selective-disclosure-sd-jwt.
The SD-JWT and the Disclosures are issued as a single concatenated string, with the tilde ~ serving as a separator.
The first block comprises the SD-JWT, while the remainder constitutes the Disclosures.
~ ~ ~ ...

SD-JWT=..

Disclosure is created as follow:

1) Create an array of three elements in this order: salt (base64url-encode minimum 128 bits of cryptographically secure pseudorandom data), claim name, claim value;

2) JSON-encode the array generated at the step 1, producing an UTF-8 string:
$ echo -n '["pZ5MRyOxpVWZuHLoJ-yjRg","tax_id_code","RSSMRA80R01H501B"]'
--> ["pZ5MRyOxpVWZuHLoJ-yjRg","tax_id_code","RSSMRA80R01H501B"]

3) base64url-encode the byte representation of the UTF-8 string produced at the step 2 (the result is the Disclosure)
$ echo -n '["pZ5MRyOxpVWZuHLoJ-yjRg","tax_id_code","RSSMRA80R01H501B"]' | openssl base64 -a -A | sed 's/+/-/g; s,/,_,g; s/=//g'
--> WyJwWjVNUnlPeHBWV1p1SExvSi15alJnIiwidGF4X2lkX2NvZGUiLCJSU1NNUkE4MFIwMUg1MDFCIl0

In the example given here, within the claim _sd of the payload of the SD-JWT we found the base64url-encode of the SHA256 digest of the disclosure 'WyJwWjVNUnlPeHBWV1p1SExvSi15alJnIiwidGF4X2lkX2NvZGUiLCJSU1NNUkE4MFIwMUg1MDFCIl0'
$ echo -n 'W1wicFo1TVJ5T3hwVldadUhMb0oteWpSZ1wiLFwidGF4X2lkX2NvZGVcIixcIlJTU01SQTgwUjAxSDUwMUJcIl0'| openssl sha256 -binary | openssl base64 -a -A | sed 's/+/-/g; s,/,_,g; s/=//g'
--> WIilTHgXkryvO4HdJATdqoYK3J8WSQAIujGxe1fb8bE

{
"_sd": [
"NOxVzjUJg667iBdeDwmr6tZ46X-jchKwIVxMAfv43yc",
"wyfxVqq9BosPT7tN4SHOI4E48P19aVA1ktW5Zf0E-fc",
"UHChpGtNF2bj1FvAfBby1rnf7WXkxelFJ5a4vSj2FO4",
"TK2RguPYoXzCx0vv5hbN9u5M2mHlWBt41qGWlLXCNu8",
"WIilTHgXkryvO4HdJATdqoYK3J8WSQAIujGxe1fb8bE"
],
"exp": 1883000000,
"iss": "https://pidprovider.example.org",
"sub": "NzbLsXh8uDCcd7noWXFZAfHkxZsRGC9Xs",
"status": {
"status_attestation": {
"credential_hash_alg": "sha-256"
}
},
"vct": "PersonIdentificationData",
"_sd_alg": "sha-256",
"cnf": {
"jwk": {
"kty": "EC",
"crv": "P-256",
"x": "TCAER19Zvu3OHF4j4W4vfSVoHIP1ILilDls7vCeGemc",
"y": "ZxjiWWbZMQGHVWKVQ4hbSIirsVfuecCE6t4jT9F2HZQ"
}
}
}

get.summary: Retrieve Entity Configuration of eID Provider.

schema.description: Metadata that an Entity publishes about itself (in signed JWT format), verifiable with a trusted third party (Superior Entity). It's called Entity Configuration. (View the JSON schema).

post.summary: The Issuer provides the Wallet Instance with a Status Attestation.

parameters.name: credential_pop
parameters.description:
The Wallet Instance sends the Status Attestation Request to the Issuer. The request MUST contain the Credential Proof of Possession JWT, signed with the private key related to the public key contained within the Credential..

Header is a JSON object with this JSON schema

Payload is a JSON object with this JSON schema

error_description.description: Text in human-readable form providing further details to clarify the nature of the error encountered
error_description.example: The signature of credential_pop JWT is not valid

error_description.description: Text in human-readable form providing further details to clarify the nature of the error encountered
error_description.example: The Digital Credential can not be found by the Issuer

error_description.description: Text in human-readable form providing further details to clarify the nature of the error encountered
error_description.example: The Issuer encountered an internal problem.

error_description.description: Text in human-readable form providing further details to clarify the nature of the error encountered

post.summary: A Wallet Instance request the revocation of a Digital Credential

parameters.name: credential_pop
parameters.description:
The Wallet Instance sends the Revocation Request to the Issuer. The request MUST contain the Credential Proof of Possession JWT, signed with the private key related to the public key contained within the Credential.

Header is a JSON object with this JSON schema

Payload is a JSON object with this JSON schema

error_description.description: Text in human-readable form providing further details to clarify the nature of the error encountered
error_description.example: The issuer cannot fulfill the request because of invalid parameters

error_description.description: Text in human-readable form providing further details to clarify the nature of the error encountered
error_description.example: The Digital Credential to be revoked can not be found by the Issuer.

error_description.description: Text in human-readable form providing further details to clarify the nature of the error encountered
error_description.example: The Issuer encountered an internal problem.

error_description.description: Text in human-readable form providing further details to clarify the nature of the error encountered

get.summary: Login request for starting a user authentication flow to a specific SAML IdP
get.description:
1. Client sends a login request to the Service Provider (SP) for starting a user authentication flow to a specific Identity Provider (IdP);
  2. The Service Provider (SP) generates an identifier for the login request received ('RelayState'), creates a SAML authentication request and signs it;
  3. The SP redirects the Wallet Instance to the IdP with the SAML authentication request, the signature, the signature algorithm used and the RelayState;
  4. The IdP validates the SAML authentication request;
  5. The IdP authenticates the user by prompting for a username and password or some other authentication factor
  6. Upon successful authentication, the IdP generates a SAML response that include the SAML authentication assertion contains user identity and authentication context data and signs it;
  7. The IdP redirects the Wallet Instance to the Assertion Consumer Service of the SP (specified inside the "AssertionConsumerService" element of the SP Metadata) with the generated SAML Response, the signature, the signature algorithm and the RelayState;

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Contains the unique application session identifier at the Wallet Instance side

parameters.name: idphint
parameters.description: The identifier of the hinted Identity Provider (entityID), in URL-encoded format

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: Redirection URI of the SP, in URL-encoded format, to which the SP Assertion Consumer Service redirects the Wallet Instance with the SAML assertion extracted from the verified SAML Response (SP forward the request to the /authorization endpoint of the authorization server of eID Provider translating the SAML assertion to text plane values in HTTP heades).

Location.description: The Location response header indicates the URL of Identity Provider SSO seervice to redirect the Wallet Instance to. This URL present in query string the SANL authorization request (parameter 'SAMLRequest'), the signature (parameter 'Signature'), the signature algorithm (parameter 'SigAlg') and the login request id (parameter 'RelayState').

post.summary: Validating the SAML Response comes from a SAML IdP after successfully login
post.description: • SP validates the SAML response received from the Identity Provider and the SAML assertion that is contained in this response, creates a session for the authenticated user populated with the attributes extracted from the SAML assertion and redirects the Wallet Instance to the callback URI of the SP setting a session cookie ('sp_user_session') containing the unique user session identifier at the SP side (the callback URI is specified into the 'target' parameter of the login request previously recevived from the client)

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Contains the unique application session identifier at the Wallet Instance side

Location.description: The Location response header indicates the URL to which the instance wallet should be redirected. In this case the wallet instance will be redirected to the callback

Set-Cookie.description: Contains the unique user session identifier at the SP side

get.summary: Forwarding authenticated user data to the /authorize_int endpoint of the eID Provider
get.description:
1. The SP validates the Wallet Instance request;
  2. The SP extracts the unique user session identifier at the SP side from the session cookie 'sp_user_session' and use it for retrieving user data from his internal user session;
  3. The SP forwards the request to the /authorize_int endpoint of eID Provider adding in header HTTP the user data extracted from the 'cookie sp_user_session' (eIDAS minimum set and authentication level) and the unique application session identifier at the Wallet Instance side extracted from the 'cookie state'.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Contains the unique application session identifier at the Wallet Instance side

parameters.name: sp_user_session
parameters.description: Contains the unique user session identifier at the SP side

Location.description: The Location response header indicates the URL to forward the Wallet Instance to Eht internat Authorization Service of the eId Provider

client_id.description: MUST be set to the base64url encoded SHA-256 thumbprint of the public key specified inside the claim 'jwt' (in JWT format) of the cnf parameter of the Wallet Attestation JWT

code_challenge.description: A challenge derived from the code verifier that is sent in the authorization request

code_challenge_method.description: A method that was used to derive code challenge. It MUST be set to 'S256'

request.description: It MUST be a signed JWT (View the JSON schema). The private key corresponding to the public one in the cnf parameter inside the Wallet Attestation JWT MUST be used for signing the Request Object

client_assertion_type.description: It MUST be set to 'urn:ietf:params:oauth:client-assertion-type:jwt-client-attestation' (in URL-encoded format)

client_assertion.description: It MUST be set to a value containing the Wallet Attestation (in signed JWT format) and the Proof of Possession of the Wallet Attestation (in signed JWT format) separated with the ~ character

request_uri.description: The request URI corresponding to the authorization request posted. This URI MUST be a single-use reference to the respective authorization request. It MUST contain some part generated using a cryptographically strong pseudorandom algorithm. The value format MUST be urn:ietf:params:oauth:request_uri:<reference-value> with <reference-value> as the random part of the URI that references the respective authorization request data

expires_in.description: Integer, it represents the lifetime in seconds of the request URI

code.description: The authorization code returned in the Authorization Response

redirect_uri.description: It MUST be set as the Request Objectredirect_uri claim of the PAR Request

code_verifier.description: Verification code of the code_challenge of the PAR Request

client_assertion_type.description: It MUST be set to 'urn:ietf:params:oauth:client-assertion-type:jwt-client-attestation' (in URL-encoded format)

client_assertion.description: It MUST be set to a value containing the Wallet Attestation (in signed JWT format) and the Proof of Possession of the Wallet Attestation (in signed JWT format) separated with the ~ character

access_token.description: The DPoP-bound Access Token (in signed JWT format) allows accessing the PID/(Q)EAA Credential Endpoint for obtaining Credentials specified in the PAR Request

token_type.description: Type of Access Token returned. It MUST be equal to 'DPoP'

expires_in.description: Expiry time of the Access Token in seconds

c_nonce.description: String containing a nonce value to be used to create a proof of possession of Private key material when requesting a Credential

c_nonce_expires_in.description: Integer, it represents the lifetime in seconds of the c_nonce

authorization_details.description: Array, used to identify the authorized Verifiable Credential types with the DPoP-bound Access Token

entity_configuration.description: Metadata that an Entity publishes about itself (in signed JWT format), verifiable with a trusted third party (Superior Entity). It's called Entity Configuration. (View the JSON schema).

format.description: Format of the verifiable credential type to be issued. This MUST be 'vc+sd-jwt' (selective disclosure JWT format)
Format of the verifiable credential issued. This MUST be 'vc+sd-jwt'

credential.description:
The verifiable credential (VC) is a digitally signed JWT carrying the information about a subject in clear text and containing digests/thumbprints over the selectively disclosable claims with the Disclosures outside the document, using the format defined in draft-ietf-oauth-selective-disclosure-jwt-07 and draft-selective-disclosure-sd-jwt.
The SD-JWT and the Disclosures are issued as a single concatenated string, with the tilde ~ serving as a separator.
The first block comprises the SD-JWT, while the remainder constitutes the Disclosures.
~~~...~

SD-JWT=..

Disclosure is created as follow:
  • Create a JSOM array of 3 strings:
    • A salt value base64url encoded;
    • The claim name as it would be used in a regular JWT payload;
    • The claim value as it would be used in a regular JWT payload.
  • base64url encoded the JSON array, producing a string. This string is the Disclosure
The following example illustrates the steps described above.
The JSON array created is: ["pZ5MRyOxpVWZuHLoJ-yjRg", "tax_id_code", "TINIT-XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX"]
The resulting Disclosure would be: WyJwWjVNUnlPeHBWV1p1SExvSi15alJnIiwgInRheF9pZF9jb2RlIiwgIlRJTklULVhYWFhYWFhYWFhYWFhYWFgiXQ

c_nonce.description: String containing a nonce value to be used to create a proof of possession of key material when requesting a further Credential

c_nonce_expires_in.description: Integer, it represents the lifetime in seconds of the c_nonce

status_attestation.description: The Issuer then returns the Status Attestation to the Wallet Instance as a signed JWT

error_description.description: Text in human-readable form providing further details to clarify the nature of the error encountered
error_description.example: The proof field is not present or the provided key proof is invalid or not bound to a nonce provided by the Credential Issuer.

error_description.description: Text in human-readable form providing further details to clarify the nature of the error encountered
error_description.example: The redirect_uri is not valid for the given client

error_description.description: Text in human-readable form providing further details to clarify the nature of the error encountered
error_description.example: If the request did not use the POST method, the authorization server responds with an HTTP 405 (Method Not Allowed) status code

error_description.description: Text in human-readable form providing further details to clarify the nature of the error encountered
error_description.example: If the request size was beyond the upper bound that the authorization server allows, the authorization server responds with an HTTP 413 (Payload Too Large) status code.

error_description.description: Text in human-readable form providing further details to clarify the nature of the error encountered
error_description.example: If the number of requests from a Wallet Instance during a particular time period exceeds the number the authorization server allows, the authorization server responds with an HTTP 429 (Too Many Requests) status code.

error_description.description: Text in human-readable form providing further details to clarify the nature of the error encountered
Text in human-readable form providing further details to clarify the nature of the error encountered

type.description: The authorization details type. It MUST be set to 'openid_credential'

credential_configuration_id.description: The unique identifier of the authorized Verifiable Credential type

type.description: Array of one string, used to identify the verifiable credential type requested

CredentialRequest_credential_definition.description: JSON object containing the verifiable credential type requested

proof_type.description: String denoting the proof type. It MUST be 'jwt'

jwt.description: The base64url encoded SHA-256 thumbprint of the public key specified inside the claim 'jwt' of the JWT proof (in JWK format) the issued Credentials shall be bound to

CredentialRequest_proof.description: JSON object containing a reference to the public key specified inside the JWT proof (in JWK format) the issued Credentials shall be bound to

relayState.description: The unique login request identifier previously received from the client
